website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, yet sturdy, controller that works well with most versions of Windows, although it may not be the most durable option.
pros: Compatible with a wide variety of games, both old and new
Support for Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8, and 10
Controller is wired, with a 5.8-foot cable
Features 10 programmable buttons and an 8-way D-pad
cons: Floating D-pad is not the greatest quality
Some claim that this option dies within a year

website_summaries.verdict: A PC gamepad that features Xbox button styling and works with a broad range of games.
pros: Works with Windows XP, Vista, and 7 (users say 8 as well, although you may need to get the driver off the Logitech site)
Has 10 buttons and an eight-way D-pad, all programmable through the included Profiler software
cons: Triggers can be a little stiff
Some buyers felt the D-pad was poorly designed
Some cite durability issues (arrived dead or stopped working within a few weeks)

customer_reviews.title: Works in Teslas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my Tesla Model 3. I found it difficult to play the video games with the steering wheel or touch screen. So far, and I have only had it a few days it is holding up well and as improved my game scores. Seems to be of good quality, remember, this is going to sit in my center console when not in use so it isn't the best environment for a game controller. If you have Beach Buggy 2 from release 2019.20.4.2 in your Tesla with MCU 2, don't expect to be able to use the game controller with that game. The game is a beta and the game controller isn't enabled yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery C. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very good controller. Buttons aren't as good as an official DualShock
customer_reviews.text: For a wired controller, this is a pretty good and less expensive alternative to the official controller. The main issue is the button inputs aren't quality as fluid and consistent as the original. The buttons are a bit too firm to start, but gets better with more use. Give it some decent break-in time for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Works for the Tesla Model 3
customer_reviews.text: Works for cuphead and beach buggy 2! That's the whole reason I bought this and I'll probably buy another for player 2.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad.  -2 stars for the Horrible, Horrible, and perhaps dangerous packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Pad itself is great. No complaints. But..guys.. the packaging. This is horrible. It's the usual 'tough plastic blister pack'. You'll need knives, x-acto's, strength, and luck to open it; all the while risking cutting or injuring yourself; not to mention the chance of damaging the product or it's cabling .. and it's probably enviornmentally bad as well. I've never really complained on packaging. But this. Is. Horrible. Works great with Tesla model 3!
customer_reviews.author: A Guy named Mike in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Works out of box for Linux Mint OS.
customer_reviews.text: It was plug n play in Linux Mint 19.3. I had already updated to the latest kernel, so don't know if that contributed. The action/feel is great. Feels like a good quality product. I will eventually buy a 2nd one (or the Logitech F710) so my son, daughter, and I can play. PS: The IFYOO ONE Pro Wired USB Gaming Gamepad that I bought did not work at all. And, I am not so young where figuring out how to make it work is worth my time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for My Minor Gaming Needs
customer_reviews.text: I was once an avid game player since the late 70's arcade - 2015, but not so much these days. I'm a 50+ year ole GrandMother ... heehee. This is just like the PlayStation Controller in every respect of their design and feel. It's pretty accurate for the games I have like Doom, Destiny and Sansar. It's lightweight, yet sturdy enough to handle a few falls here & there and still work. But don't abuse it just because.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Steam
customer_reviews.text: This is the one of the cheapest options that is fully supported (at the time of writing) on Steam. Great for older games or console ports on a PC. The quality is excellent, just like the Logitech Dual Action controller from the old days when controllers were everywhere, but updated to include the XInput - DirectInput switch on back for compatibility. Is there anything this won't work with? Possibly, but I don't know, it works with everything I have. There is no vibration or wireless, but the thing just works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worse Quality
customer_reviews.text: I like PS2 style Gamepad. No special reason, but personal preference. F310 was suitable for my need for only few days, and then... Let the trouble begin... XYZ is not accuracy after calibration after few days usage. In addition, LB, RB are not functional well any more. What the quality is it? It's good for price and ergonomic design, but not good for the quality. Update 8/23 Exchange with Amazon another one to try again, and it's good for playing a while; however, it comes out another problem while swapping game to play. Between Evil within and Dark Souls, L sticker is not accuracy, and failed to calibrate under both steam and windows... :(
customer_reviews.author: Jiunjr Feng

customer_reviews.title: Quality controller
customer_reviews.text: This is a good controller for all types of games. Both the analog sticks and the d-pad are good, depending on the type of games you are using it for. The dpad is super responsive for retro style games and the analog sticks work as they should for modern games. It feels sturdy and the buttons are also well made and responsive. The triggers have a bit more resistance to them than the average licensed Sony or Microsoft controllers, but not uncomfortable. The only complaint is that the cord is kind of short. I had to get some 3 foot USB extenders to make these reach where I sit and play.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bee

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: I have a Win 10 home operating system and the gamepad works with no issues. The device got detected and the driver installed with no issues. I have no issues with it's construction or ergonomics. Most of the games I play are not really designed for gamepads but the one game I bought this for 'Witcher 3' works like a charm. Compared to other more expensive gamepad this is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Defiant

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Tesla in car games
customer_reviews.text: Tested this, the Logitech F310, and the Lilyhood PS4 wired controller in my Tesla Model 3 for gameplay and the Logitech F310 is the clear winner. The Lilyhood worked for some of the initial games that rolled out but stopped at beach buggy racing and Cuphead. The Logitech works with the games very smoothly and is comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect controller
customer_reviews.text: What I like about the Logitech F310 controller: - The price is right - The buttons are durable - Most interactions feel good on this controller What I don't like: - The thumb sticks are about 25% too high, which creates extra travel time that makes it difficult to react quickly when playing twitch platformers like Celeste. - The D-pad buttons could perform slightly better. Overall: - If you need a cheap, reliable controller, this is a great one to get. I am using two at home and they both perform well, with one of them being over a year old.
customer_reviews.author: Taikero

customer_reviews.title: Great controller with a few tweaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play old school games on my RetroPie emulation system. It works great, but required a few tweaks to get it going. First, the ABXY button layout is different than that of the SNES. This made me really confused until I remapped the buttons. Second, the RetroArch emulation system has a lot of trouble with this controller depending on if it's in Xbox or DualShock mode (switch on the back of the controller). If you're having problems, try playing with that. Now that it's working, it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ferretti

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Up front, I prefer keyboard and mouse for PC gaming. I bought this for use with RecalBox running on a Raspberry Pi 3B. It was very easy to setup all of the buttons and worked very well. I have also let my son use it to play games on Windows, and it works very well without any setup. He's used it on Just Cause 3, Far Cry 4, Skyrim, and Hello Neighbor. Cord could be a hair longer in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: cwa90

customer_reviews.title: Linux Steam Compatible
customer_reviews.text: It is recognized by the Linux kernel specifically and correctly as "Logitech, Inc. F310 Gamepad". I have used it to play many Steam games on Linux and it works exactly as one would hope. Sometimes I accidentally hit the "Mode" button instead of the "Back" button which is nearby, but I also appreciate having various modes to solve irritating compatibility issues that may arise. I had the top right trigger stick a bit but it sorted itself out. After 50 hours of use, I can say that if you need a game controller for Linux, this one is well worth the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great for old games
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son. He is a gamer and loves to play old games. This is the one of the cheapest options that is fully supported (at the time of writing) on Steam. Great for older games or console ports on a PC. The quality is excellent, just like the Logitech Dual Action controller from the old days when controllers were everywhere, but updated to include the XInput - DirectInput switch on back for compatibility. Is there anything this won't work with? Possibly, but I don't know, it works with everything I have. There is no vibration or wireless, but the thing just works. I purchased another 1.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Crespo

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good controller overall, though it doesn't quite compare to more expensive ones made by console manufacturers. The analog sticks have unusual dead-zones and are a bit stiff, the triggers require too much force, and I think the ergonomic design could be a bit better. I didn't find any of these flaws to be critical, though, and the F310 is quite a bit better than most other controllers in its price range. The ability to easily switch between Xinput and DirectInput is also a pretty nice perk, as it means it can be used for both older and newer games with minimal setup.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Kills my hand.
customer_reviews.text: I like how this performs. The only problem is that it's slowly carpal tunneling my hand to hell. Is it worth the trade for a good gaming experience? I'll have a better answer for you when my hand becomes a claw.
customer_reviews.author: James Albright

customer_reviews.title: Broke After A Week
customer_reviews.text: I normally have nothing but good things to say about Logitech. I use their keyboards and mice at work and home and have gotten years of reliable use out of them, but this controller broke (the right trigger quit responding) after a week of playing Farming Simulator, hardly an intense game. That's simply unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Perfect performance and cheap
customer_reviews.text: I tried wireless controllers for my entertainment center PC... but only a wired connection game me the reliability and response time necessary for a living room game experience. The Logitech F710 felt great, but would drop commands once every 15-20 min... just enough to ruin an intense game. The wired controller isn't nearly as convenient (having to coil it up to neaten my living room), but any time I die in a game, I know it's my fault, not my equipment. I especially like that the control sticks are both at the bottom (unlike the asymmetric control stick layout on the traditional X-Box controller).
customer_reviews.author: Jason F.

customer_reviews.title: Great budget gamepad
customer_reviews.text: Overall great playstation like keypad for my PC. Through use, I have an issue where my right shoulder button does not click or register being pressed. (Fixable) I was able to open the controller and found that the micro switch for that button got dislodged slightly making it 'unpressable'. I'll be honest, I'm not sure if this is from abuse/hard pressing, or a quality control issue. I was able to reseat the micro switch and close the controller back up and get full functionality back again. But this has happened twice now, and can be inconvenient. But for the price I paid, it's still worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Works PERFECTLY in My Tesla Model 3 to Play Cuphead - LOVE IT - PLUG AND PLAY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this controller specifically to play Cuphead in my Tesla Model 3. I plugged the controller into the Tesla's USB port and it worked flawlessly. I don't need such a long cord so i just leave a portion of the cord coiled up. I know some controllers do not play nicely with the Tesla. THIS ONE WORKED PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.author: EKC

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these so my girlfriend would play games with me. She had played a Playstation before and so she was more comfortable with that kind of controller layout. These have worked great for us. Worked right out of the box (plug & play). The only think I don't really like is the depth of the curved, underside. It can make it a little cumbersome to pull your finger out from the underside to one of the shoulder/trigger buttons. Other than that, no complaints. Happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Buttons sticking/breaking after 1 month light use
customer_reviews.text: I would otherwise quite like this controller - but the buttons are sticking and breaking after 1 month of light use by a 4 year old girl. Hasnt been used much either. Clearly shows that button mechanics were designed with very low presses-lifetime. Very disappointed, usually logitech makes solid products that last.
customer_reviews.author: EPI

customer_reviews.title: Work on Macbook Pro and Tesla
customer_reviews.text: Even though manual did not indicate it will work on Macbook Pro and Tesla, I have tested and both are compatible with this Logitech Gamepad F310 without any driver or additional software installed. for Tesla, it is plug and play, and for Macbook Pro, you will need to press Logitech button on the gamepad to initiate connection with Max OS after plug in USB port. The feel and response for this gamepad is top rated and comparable with PS4 controller.
customer_reviews.author: Duty Free

customer_reviews.title: Decent controller.
customer_reviews.text: I like this controller for the most part. Is fairly comfortable in my large hands and works really well with my gaming PC. I wish the "Mode" button had a lock on it. I find myself hitting the button often by accident and it is super annoying to have to switch it back in the middle of a game.
customer_reviews.author: Corkscrew

customer_reviews.title: Wore out quickly
customer_reviews.text: First I will say the "mode" button is annoying. I would regularly be hitting it when going for the "Back" button, until I took the controller apart and removed it. But my real complaint is the fact that this thing only lasted a year before the left stick started drifting. I don't use this every day. I only use it with one game, and even though I have owned it for about 12 months, I haven't used it but a quarter of that time, and only a few hours every couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great controller - but beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great controller, and I own many of them. They're very cost effective for those that want to play games with friends. The D-pad is one of the best I've used (outside of Nintendo), the buttons are response, the analog sticks are great, it's a good weight, and very comfortable to use for extended periods of time. The only downside to these is that they have poorly made stress relief connectors. So, if you tend to wrap up your controllers around it, then it will eventually have a short. So, I recommend storing them carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Joey D.

customer_reviews.title: Works for a MAC
customer_reviews.text: Works on a Mac! You may have to use the "configure game control" menu on each game, but it does work on a mac / apple. There is a button that allows you to change the left hand XY control from the small joystick (left side) to the pad. Also, there is a slide switch on the bottom of the controller that has two settings "X" and "D". Ours has worked on everything if this switch is set to "D".
customer_reviews.author: M&PK

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these controllers but this is the third one I've bought where the buttons break after a few months. This one had the R button freeze in place three days after the return window closed. I ordered two and one is still working, but I shouldn't have to spend another $20 just to get a month or two of use. I don't drop them, throw them, or let them get spills or crumbs in/on them, so using them to play games an hour or two a day shouldn't be enough to wear them out like this.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Bought for use with Raspberry Pi 4
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this controller. It is useful for a wide range of games. Everything from the old Atari games to the newer N64. Its the same layout as a PS3 controller. Seems solid. I have big hands and it fits nicely in them. Im running RetroPie on my Raspberry and it recognized the gamepad and is easy to set up. Cord length is decent. I sit about 4-5 feet from the tv and the controller has some slack. I still like the feel of using the correct controller with what system I am playing, but a lot of times I just want one controller ro do it all and so far this seems to fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Pongo

customer_reviews.title: For my retropie, this is probably the cheapest and best solution.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I got this for my retropie install which a lot of people recommended. It does the job but the size of it just weird. Its too big for my kids hands and its too small to accommodate my fingers for the trigger buttons. I would have to say though, if you need an all-in-one controller to cover the most games for a nice emulation station, this is probably the one to grab.
customer_reviews.author: simple SW man.Top Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and long lasting controller for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these game pads for many years and just recently the left trigger finally broke on it while one of the bumpers were also getting stiff, as well as the d-pad becoming less sensitive, but only after at least 5 years of use. I never had any drifting issues with the analog sticks either, and the d-pad is a lot easier to use precisely than an Xbox One controller's. Overall I find the controller easier to handle than an Xbox One controller. I honestly think the ONLY con with this control is no rumble function, but if you want a controller that's very reliable, definitely get this!
customer_reviews.author: Jamieson LoBue

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, works, cheap.
customer_reviews.text: In the days of $150 gaming controllers, this one still shines. It does exactly what it's supposed to do, at an extremely reasonable price. Obviously doesn't have all the bells and whistles compared to the Premium controllers, but if you don't need all that, then save yourself over $100 and here you go. I dinged one star because it's not as comfortable as an Xbox or PS4 controller, but it's still a lot less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works with Steam and GTA V
customer_reviews.text: I use this game pad mostly for GTA V on my computer. My PS3 crashed, so I made the jump to PC. When I did, I picked up this game pad as it works just like the game pad with my PS3. It is a USB connection and works well. The joysticks are pressure-sensitive too. I just wish more games worked with a game pad on Steam. Or those that do will not put me at a disadvantage with other players who have a mouse/keyboard combo.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Hull

customer_reviews.title: Controversial opinion: I am a fan of the D-pad for fighting game (while it lasts)
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchase multiple of these controllers for their D-pad feel in fighting games. Tekken specifically. You do have to treat it as a consumable in that it wears down over time and then it will just become a regular controller as the d pad will not go back to neutral as fast as it gets used more; but will still work perfectly fine for any other type of game where d-pad responsiveness does not have to be perfect. Also for under $25 or even less on sale, any complaints I would have regarding longevity are really moot as you can stock up on multiple of these for the price of 1 "premium" controller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my Windows 7 gaming machine! Plug and play and immediately recognized and started gaming. The 'handles' are a little 'bulbous' even for adult size "average" hands, in my opinion..not so big that they are uncomfortable or you get sore/carpal tunnel, but just a little bigger than an older Playstation 1 style, for example. Other than that a great little gaming controller for the average, casual gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody

customer_reviews.title: Please keep making them.
customer_reviews.text: Second game pad i have bought. After HEAVY use i had to get a new one. Bought a xbox controller for pc gaming. It just wasn’t the same as logitech pad. Button layout, response, i really prefer logitech. It could be my familiarity but i really gave the xbox pad a shot. I could never program the buttons to do the actions i wanted. Where as logitech pad was just default to what i want. Hope they keep making these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Warren Durkin

customer_reviews.title: Nice Budget Controller
customer_reviews.text: Not too expensive, very good on a budget. Works with the games I need it to on my gaming laptop. It's a nice size and easy to handle, not too bulky like an XBox controller. If you don't require something fancy this one will do the job, you can also upgrade to a slightly more expensive one if you want a rumble feature or want it to work wirelessly. I prefer playing my games with a wired controller because wireless ones tend to have a slight delay in input.
customer_reviews.author: Seattleite

customer_reviews.title: Trigger Buttons are the Worst in Any Controller I've Used
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this controller for nearly four years now. Not bad for third person adventure, platformer, and action games (non-shooters), but horrible for any FPS, top-down, and third person shooters. All because of the horrible LT/RT triggers, their pressure sensitivity is the worst for quickly shooting any non automatic weapons. Many times I would get killed without barely getting one shot off because of these crappy triggers. Save a bit more and buy a better controller.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Does work on Mac .
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my 2017 MacBook Pro and at first I thought it wasn’t working but in time I figured it out. The instructions and manuals don’t really give you a lot Of information and I sorta blame Logitech for that but I won’t blame the product as it works flawlessly. It’s a very sturdy built product with good button response and a very ergonomic feel while holding it. If I could describe it I’d say it feels like a PlayStation controller with a tiny more bulk which for my hand feels better. You have more control and better comfort. I would buy this again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Best General Gaming Controller Hands Down
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller. I have used these Logitech controllers for years, and now I have been using them to bundle up with the RetroPie consoles I have been building for my family for X-Mas gifts this year. I now own 6 of these being used on three desktop computers and 3 Laptops, and I have yet to have one wear out or break. They are like the Energizer Bunny. They just keep going and going and going!
customer_reviews.author: mathgeek669

customer_reviews.title: Great for emulated games
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play some emulated old Nintendo games. It works fine for this function. The only downside was that it was a little tricky to manually program the buttons. The instructions don't help much. It does have the ability to play new games and supposedly doesn't need to be manually programmed. I have yet to use it for a new application. If you want it to play some games on the computer and aren't looking for anything too elaborate, I think it's great; Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was just getting into gaming and using the keyboard wasn’t easy for me. However, when I tried this controller for a shooter it wasn’t as useful as I’d hoped. The buttons are a bit stiff, the triggers in particular. I think this will be fine for many games, but for the 1st person shooters it wasn’t as accurate as shooting with a mouse. I am fond of the PS style shape. I have always preferred that to XBox controllers. I prefer the symmetry.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Tesla Model 3 Games
customer_reviews.text: Can play Beach Buggy 2 and Cuphead. All the old atari games as well. Great controller if you own a Tesla Model 3!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It absolutely works for any PC games out there, tested tons of them. It's cheap, you pay more for Xbox controller and when you compare, you realize why did you pay more for Xbox controller. There's nothing wrong with Logitech except it feels chap, material is cheap when you hold it in your hands for hours it might even give you blisters because .....did I say it feels cheap?
customer_reviews.author: Ysr

customer_reviews.title: Great all around controllers for various platforms.
customer_reviews.text: Great controllers at a good price. I have been using these Logitech game pads for a long time. Since Windows XP. They last a long time, and are easy on your hands. I can verify they work with retro console emulators found on the web. Sega and Nintendo. Works in Windows, or Mac OSX. Works with Retropie running on RaspberryPie v3 too. Cant go wrong here, especially if you catch them on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Macspt

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my PS3 controller, as it kinda bit the dust. The controller worked fine out of the box, and I didn't have any technical issues with it. For me personally, it doesn't feel as good as a PS3 controller, especially with the D-pad and shoulder buttons, but for that price, I am willing to overlook it. One other issue is that it would not recognize the controller at first. I had to unplug and plug it a few times to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Dee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gamepad, Mostly
customer_reviews.text: This gamepad was excellent, worked perfectly for about 4 years, then the right shoulder button broke. The rest of the controller works perfectly, and is very responsive and easy to use. I still use it with games that don't require the right shoulder button. I have no problem buying another. I have had gamepads with buttons that broke earlier than this. You can't replace the shoulder button without having to solder the connections.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tomasin

customer_reviews.title: True plug n play
customer_reviews.text: This remote is fantastic for the price point, I got my package and 5 minutes later was playing, true plug and play. The size and shape are very comfortable and the buttons have the satisfying click. The cord length is reasonable for most people but for my setup I could use a little longer cord. I truly have no negatives at this time. I will update this review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Poe

customer_reviews.title: worked on my Mac Book, no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Got a usb c adaptor, plugged it in and this joystick worked well with my 2019 MacBook pro. No issues. Get one or two. You can play games or swing it around your head and yell at the cat. Heck; it can be a doorstop, a paperweight, or just a decoration you can throw up in a tree in front of your Uncle's house. You can lick it, stick it, pick it and tick it off your bucket list.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best PC/360/PS3 controller for the price.
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to gaming controllers there are a lot to choose. But nothing beats a wired controller when it comes down to needing responsiveness in competitive play. Coupled with the F310 customization software (found by going here  ) makes this controller one powerful game-pad. Pros: 1. Full customization (Using logitech's Software) 2. Very Responsive controls. Cons: 1. Feels a tad bit big, even for someone with big hands. 2. The analog, although having rounded edged, are completely flat. This can be improved by using replacement nubs for PS3/360 Controllers such as these  Additionally check out this video about the controller and some of the setup features
customer_reviews.author: Geist Von PA

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Want to know my bias? I'm an xbox controller guy. But my xbox controllers break and stop working so I need something new to play monster hunter world. Anyway, the ONLY issue I have with this thing is that its ergonomically funky. It has a super sharp slant in the back to where I cant figure out how to place my fingers. Otherwise, joysticks are good. The buttons are very fun to press. And the right and left triggers aren't downpress.... they're like springs, which is odd but I dig it. Except for the odd gripping situation, its perfect. Worked the second I plugged it in my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Begue

customer_reviews.title: good buttons, serviceable dpad, mediocre sticks
customer_reviews.text: the controller is perfectly adequate for games that don't require precise inputs on the analog sticks (e.g. games that are turn based). the dpad is a bit mushy (i.e. not much tactile feedback to let you know when you transition from one direction to another). there's very large horizontal and vertical deadzones on both analog sticks. this results in it feeling like there's a bias towards the cardinal directions. other than that, the build quality feels fine. unfortunately the dead zones on the analog sticks are a pretty big deal for me, so I can't fully recommend it unless you're sure that it won't matter in the types of games you plan on playing.
customer_reviews.author: Ringating

customer_reviews.title: Best USB Controller in this Price Range
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a lot of cheap USB controllers and this is the first one that seems like it will last. My kids are kind of rough on them. For the price, I think that this is the best multi-function USB gamepad out there. What is especially cool is that a lot of games are designed to work with specifically this layout, so you don't even have to program it for those games. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: What a nice and sturdy controller
customer_reviews.text: This controller was suggested to me when my old one went out. Was a little worried because it is much cheaper than most of the controllers on the market. But, I am overwhelmingly happy with it. Its built sturdy and feels good in the hands. The cord length is good and it was easy plug and play. Just plugged into the USB and was able to jump right into my games. The games built for xbox controllers on steam worked just fine and automatically connected with no issues. The response of the buttons is great. I recommend this controller.
customer_reviews.author: Remmels

customer_reviews.title: Nice controller for my PC
customer_reviews.text: I like the controller just fine. I purchased this one to have two of them available. The only thing stopping me from giving it a 5 star overall rating is the packaging. It is so hard to remove that you could injure yourself. I tried to go slow and carefully but instead of injuring myself I scratched one side of the controller. It is packaged nicely but way too hard to open up..
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Simple basic PC controller good value
customer_reviews.text: Im reviewing this product after not owning it for super long but im general im quite happy with the purchase for its value. I mean 20 bucks for controller, I got exactly what I expected. So far its been great Ive usee it foor a 1st and 3rd person shooter as well as an RPG. As an exXbox player i appreciate the ABXY button layout. Some of the buttons and triggers seem loose but everything works fine and they may even be designed that way. The design is kind of drab and plain but quite frankly I really like it and it adds to the controllers simplicity. Good value
customer_reviews.author: Galen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good but hard on older gamers
customer_reviews.text: I'm rather new to gamepads. I'm an old school mouse and keyboard guy but I finally decided to give one a try for a space fighter jockey game. It works well but I had one major issue. The LT and RT keys were very hard on your hands to keep pressed for long periods. I opened the unit up and replaced the springs with a springs that had a much softer compression. I guess if you are young it doesn't matter but if you are an older gamer, you'll probably find this product is hard on your hands unless you hack it to make it more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: When It Works...
customer_reviews.text: Web support took over a week to respond, and when they did, they never replied. Phone support. I spent an hour and a half with an agent, who had no autonomy, troubleshooting an obviously non-working product. They wanted conduct fruther advanced troubleshooting on the next business day. Phone support does not state hours of operation or wait times. Not worth my time
customer_reviews.author: dAllen

customer_reviews.title: Great Versatility and Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this PC controller is hard to beat. The xinpit/directinput switch on the back ensures you can easily play games designed for the x-box controller (most on PC these days I find) without it's limitations. It feels good in my hands and has lasted quite a few couch gaming parties. I've got four of these and prefer them over XBox One controllers. If you are used to using XBox One controllers, this will feel much lighter. If you play a wide variety of PC games with a controller, I highly advise this product. If you're very used to XBox controllers, you may find they lack the heft you're used to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wattierrez

customer_reviews.title: For this price, how could you beat it?
customer_reviews.text: So it has a cord, so what? How far away from your computer are you going to sit? This thing is seamless and works perfectly. I've played through almost an entire Tomb Raider game so far and have been loving it. I don't see why I would ever pay 50 dollars for an XBox controller when stuff like this is out there. Using this on my 6+ year old Toshiba laptop running Windows 10 to play Steam games.
customer_reviews.author: wishiwereemo

customer_reviews.title: an great controller for an low cost
customer_reviews.text: ive been using these controllers for an few years now and they tend to work pretty well and they tend to last an long time over the course of these years i think ive only had to buy 3-4 of them ever. the cord is pretty much long enough to use from an distance, need more length you can buy an cord extension. the cost is low but the quality is pretty good, just becareful not to let it get knocked around overall its worth buying them if your into pc gaming as that will lower its life which means youll end up needing another.
customer_reviews.author: shadow

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 of these this year for two separate retro (raspberry) pie builds. They work perfectly. I recently set one up on my son's computer to use with Minecraft. That took a lot of time and a few youtube videos to accomplish but overall wasn't too bad. I'm not a computer gamer but the guys that made the videos could fly through the set up on the pc.
customer_reviews.author: Big Nate

customer_reviews.title: This one instead works great. Just one flaw
customer_reviews.text: Have two at home now. I tried the F710 but definitely sometimes the buttons pressing was not being sent to the computer. This one instead works great. Just one flaw: in the inside it breaks easily: after falling down two times one of the buttons in the top left failed to click (didn't press): one of the small plastic tabs that goes against the button was broken therefore when pressing the button it had nothing to support it. I glued a tootpick (the only thing i had small enough close to me) and it works now. Anyway, it's in the inside, i would love if it would be more resistant as kids have tendency to drop things.
customer_reviews.author: Maria N. Trujillo Llanten

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Tesla Arcade!
customer_reviews.text: Using this in my car for Tesla Arcade. Works fine for Beach Buggy Racing and Cuphead. My previous controller (8bitdo) didn't work for these titles. Only con is the D-pad is wobbly but that's expected for a cheap $13 controller.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Worked with a Windows 10 PC
customer_reviews.text: My son likes PC games and some of the demos he plays only work with a controller, so I got this one to use on his PC. It works and he is happy with it. It isn’t wireless, so I don’t have to worry about batteries. It is ready when he is. The length of the wire isn’t as important when using a PC as it would be if you were across the room for an XBOX.
customer_reviews.author: Stepinwolf

customer_reviews.title: cheap and to the point
customer_reviews.text: When engaged with furious arcade action the d-pad becomes slippery with thumb-sweat. Pro tip: adhere a pad of felt or 'velcro' to the d-pad and this is no longer an issue. It's given me no other problems. I'm sure if you needed something a lot more sensitive you wouldn't be looking for a cheap product, but I'm furiously insensitive to your pain. :)
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Labombard

customer_reviews.title: These are popular for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: There nothing extra special about these but they are reliable and good. They're comfortable, install easily, and will do everything you need. The only thing I would like to see is 5 buttons on the front. then these would be perfect to use for SEGA Genesis emulation. You can still use these fine, but I would like the buttons in the same position.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Controller for the Win
customer_reviews.text: I bought a controller to use for my PC for some SNES emulators I got. They work relatively well but nothing to brag about. It sure does beat using the PC keyboard but it is in no way as smooth as some of the other controllers I have used. I still have trouble playing Super Street Fighter with the more fluid movements. It does, however, do great on more basic movement games such as Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles - Turtles in Time. So I would recommend this controller only dependent on what games you intent on playing.
customer_reviews.author: DaveTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately doesn't fit my need
customer_reviews.text: I have used Logitech products for years with great success. I was looking for a gamin PC controller and this had excellent reviews and "programmable" features. Unfortunately, it is just to sensitive for my needs to decently control game movements, even after installing the software and trying to calibrate, which is confusing in itself. I couldn't return the item because to get it open you have to cut through the frustrating packaging which destroys the ability to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Margrett Irish

customer_reviews.title: comfortable hand style
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr old grandson enjoyed this game controller; however, he felt it was a bit slower than using the keyboard on the desk. I don't do games, so I am not sure if this is true. I have Windows 10 and this worked well with a bit of toggling between the X and D button on the bottom. The description doesn't list Windows 10, but ours worked. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hassle-free controller.
customer_reviews.text: This does register as an Xbox controller. I've used it with Madden 20 and Wreckfest without any issues. So much easier than having to setup an older Rumblepad 2 with the Xbox controller emulator. I never liked the rumble anyway. Also, didn't have to calibrate the joystick function. The old Rumblepad 2 would periodically lose center.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: Works with most modern games, but....
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these last year at $20 each. The first one only lasted 7 month being used moderately, before the buttons wore completely out. The other one which just started getting some use over the past two months, now has a short in the cord and the cord even started heating up. I am just glad we noticed before the thing caught the house on fire or something. So if you buy this don't expect it to last more than a few months. It is a shame too because I really did like the feel of this controller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid USB controller
customer_reviews.text: I'm a PlayStation kid, so I found this controller to be very comfortable and easy to use. My computer immediately recognized it and I didn't have to really mess around with anything to get it to work for me. It's a good weight too; it doesn't weigh a ton but it feels substantial enough that it doesn't feel like it'll break if I drop it once or twice.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Packer

customer_reviews.title: Not emulator friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 and tried to use them with win7 x64 to play on some old n64 emulator games (mariokart, smash bros etc). These were by itself a pain to install. Not sure what happened but after awhile the logitech profiler started recognizing one, but not another, but could never get them to work. Too much of a hassle to deal with. My cheap usb S/NES gamepads did a better job, so looks like I'm sticking with super Mario bros...
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Grimaldi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this gamepad for a few months now and it has been working flawlessly. Used it on multiple emulators on the laptop and it functions properly on each. The dpad works fine, the analog sticks are accurate, and all the other buttons function as expected. I will be buying another one so that I can play some 2 player games with my son.
customer_reviews.author: Bowen

customer_reviews.title: First order was defective. Amazon helped, and quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality material takes away from a nicely-designed wired controller. Isn't missing any buttons and is a nice equivalent to more pricey models. Works with most games without any work on the part of the player. Buttons are often automatically mapped to what makes sense, making for quick plug-in and go gaming. First unit died within an hour. Amazon was responsive and effective, mailing a replacement and giving me ample time to return the defective unit. 4/5 experience, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with PS3 console, except for PS button (equivalent).
customer_reviews.text: As long as you have at least one original Sony controller you should be fine; this controller can manage all menus in PS3 except when you need the PS button. I decided to buy this cheaper Logitech branded controller because buying other non-Sony controllers seem a gamble from the reviews, assuming Logitech will stand behind this product should anything go wrong. Overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Zinn_Chomsky_Seeger

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the money, would like to see some improvements on manufacturing materials
customer_reviews.text: It's nothing fancy, decent controller for someone just getting into using a controller on a PC. I would like to see some changes to how the L1/R1, L2/R2, and D-Pad are made material-wise. The D-Pad feels like a loose, cheap plastic, and the L/R buttons just feel weird in general, especially when you push them. Other than that, it's okay. Works fine for what I purchased it for, which was to use as a controller for emulators.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This just hurts my hands. The joysticks are spread more into the inside you have to reach. Never had an issue with any other controller like this. The joysticks are just a hot mess in a whole. Everything else works fine. If you're looking for any kind of precision then this controller is for sure not what you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: ChadwickAndo

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To for PC Controller
customer_reviews.text: I have bought four of theses over the years. I have one for my PC, one for each of my sons' computers and another one I keep with my Raspberry Pi emulator. I've always had a PlayStation so I like that it has similar controls. The first Logitech controller I bought years ago is still going strong with hundreds (if not thousands) of hours played with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin V.

customer_reviews.title: The trigger buttons are a bit gritty when using them, but it clears up quickly enough.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed when plugging this in to play was a slight grittiness to the controls, as when I pressed down L2 and R2 they felt a bit like there were small bits of sand stuck between the side of the trigger and the inside of the controller. I took a little bit of compressed air to it and blew it out and it was fine afterward. The joysticks feel a bit stiff to work with, but I'm sure it will be nothing that won't clear up with enough use.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Solice

customer_reviews.title: Best controller for under $20
customer_reviews.text: This controller lasted me 5 years. I didnt take care of it, and threw it around, it took half a decade of that abuse. Its a cheap controller, it doesnt feel like the best thing in the world. Mushy buttons, and not clicky triggers. over all for under $20, that will last 5 years, thats a great deal. Oh yeah, it also works with the Ouya, for some reason
customer_reviews.author: Borok Lau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way! Updated
customer_reviews.text: Automatically hooks up with steam. The X and D switch on the bottom makes it dual controller compatible. Super durable, my friends and I played Super Smash Brothers Melee with these things and they held up perfect. Compatible with every emulator I could think of and WELL worth the price. I'd buy another one but I already did. AMAZING controller. Update: bought a used one in 2015 now it's 2017 and the d-pad is just starting to act up on one of them. Highly impressed with its hold up thus far, everything else works perfect still. The second controller I bought used and is still holding up perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Camden

customer_reviews.title: Works Well but Small
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is responsive, haven't had any issue with the buttons or sticks. My only complaint is the ergonomics. It's a little on the small side and the rear trigger placement is not the best. And I don't have particularly large hands, so if you do have large hands you may want to look elsewhere. For comparison it's a little bit smaller than a Playstation DualShock controller but the button/stick layout is almost identical.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel N.

customer_reviews.title: Triggers get stuck
customer_reviews.text: Recently this controller has been having issues with the left and right triggers. I will use them and after the trigger resets the game acts as if I'm holding/rapidly pressing the trigger. Controller is less than a year old and is a complete let down. I do NOT recommend this controller until that issue is fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Did not last past 2 years. 3 out of 4 I purchased broken.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these 2 years ago and they all have issues. Some the triggers stopped working and another the cord cuts out over and over. For the time they worked, they did work well, but they just didn't hold up. Update: Over normal use the LB and RB are just not built well. Through normal use, you can push the button mechanism out of alignment and the buttons don't click back anymore. You can open them up and see that the part has moved and you can push them back into place. They don't stay long. I'm going to try and super glue them into palce and see if that fixes it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J. Von Bose

customer_reviews.title: Inexperience but very functional
customer_reviews.text: Great controller for GTA online. Comfortable and good grip. Plug and go made it easy to set up and I was able to use this for other games. Cord length is about 5 feet so good to go with plenty of cord to spare. Good price for a cheap controller. Would not go lower than this otherwise your gonna be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Murl Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Nice gamepad for the pi
customer_reviews.text: Good gamepad for my raspberry retropie setup. The only thing that doesn't work is the LT and RT are analog inputs so they don't play nicely with the pie's expectation of a switch for those and makes the initial setup a bit finicky/non-working. Since I don't use those buttons anyway I just don't map them. I also like that you can swap the analog/digital left pad/stick so you can use either/or in various games without remapping everything.
customer_reviews.author: GregTR

customer_reviews.title: Nice enough but don't expect super high quality
customer_reviews.text: The controller is fine for the price, but don't expect a PS4 or Xbox level quality. The trigger buttons are a little awkward. It's not entirely ergonomic. The direction pad feels pretty cheap and fragile. I would, however, buy it again. The price was very reasonable and after a few game sessions you get used to the feel.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: A Strong Pass
customer_reviews.text: Ive been gaming almost 10 years. 8 of them on consoles so its safe to say Ive used many controllers from Dualshocks and Xbox Controllers to Gamecube controllers including everything inbetween. I must say this is one of the worst controllers. The controller feels like a bulky dualshock. The buttons and layouts are fine. The deadzones didnt hurt on games like GTA, but FPS games like COD and Battlefield are horrible. The triggers, if you can even call them that, are the biggest issue on the controller. They are pretty much buttons in place of the triggers. After using it for a few hours I just couldn't stand it. Although logitech makes outstanding peripherals, I recomend you look else where.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected on my Tesla Model 3
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my Tesla Model 3 and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: But it feels nice and it works well when it actually wants to
customer_reviews.text: UGH the setting change with every different game. Stops working randomly. Always gotta disconnect & reconnect it. Software only finds Dungeon Keeper 2 on my computer which isn't even a controller compatible game? I have at least 50 other games and it's the only one it sees! But it feels nice and it works well when it actually wants to, and the button press feels good. But honestly? Just get a wired Xbox360 controller and the free drivers from microsoft. That's my other controller set up and it almost always works. (if there's too much plugged in on the front USB panel it doesn't work which isn't a controller problem)
customer_reviews.author: Ayris

customer_reviews.title: Worst D-pad I've ever had the misfortune to use.
customer_reviews.text: An otherwise well made controller is rendered nearly useless by the absolutely awful D-pad design. There is so much play that accurate control is almost impossible. Pressing down in the center of the pad activates all 4 directions simultaneously. This combined with the overall looseness of the action makes attempting complex sequences like those required for fighting games a futile effort. The D-pad on the bottom of the barrel $7 SNES clone game pad I have is worlds better than this POS. Another annoying feature of this controller is the "Logitech" button. It sits close enough to the Start button that it is easy to press both, causing the to switch to your desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great controller for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A great controller for the price. I use it mostly with retropie on a raspberry pi for older games. The buttons are excellent and the dpad is good for those old games. My one complaint is that the analog sticks are pretty squishy. I prefer the stiffer ones (like the gamecube controller), but it's definitely usable. It feels similar to using a playstation 2/3 controller, but I like this one a touch better. It has also been really easy to configure in retropie and in some steam games
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: So far, a solid gaming controller. I had an old logitech that I used for maybe 14 years or so before it finally reached a point where the dpad would stick and I couldn't stop it. So I said screw it and bought this one. Not disappointed at all and I hope it lasts as long as my last logitech controller.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great controller, minor problems.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the one I had (same model and everything) recently stopped accepting any kind of input. The previous controller lasted 2 years with only minor inconvenience, whereas the one I bought from amazon only lasted about 3 weeks before having any problems. The only problem I have is that the left toggle (used for parrying in sekiro) doesnt always work when held or tapped. It must be pressed so that the button is even, or else it will rapidly toggle on and off or just not toggle at all. TLDR: Great controller, just make sure everything works first.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan275555

customer_reviews.title: Great Controller - Works Perfectly Fine with Mac Computers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this controller to play emulated games on my Mac. There had been some customers asking if it will work with a Mac (as the product info says it's for Windows) but no one really seemed to agree, although most said it would if the switch on the back was flipped from "X" to "D". I figured the price was decent enough to take a risk and so I purchased two. I've played several games over a few hours since I got it and this controller works perfectly with my Mac (at time of this review, OS X Yosemite, 10.10.3) and I have not had any issues with its operation yet, and I really don't expect to.
customer_reviews.author: Yukio Kina

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Controller!
customer_reviews.text: In the past, I have owned various game controllers. But, out of all those controllers, the Logitech F310 is easily the best! It is the most comfortable, affordable, and durable. Plus, it's super easy to set-up and use with just about any PC game and nearly any emulated game. You can even set it up with Kodi, along with other programs, for an easier HTPC configuration!
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell A.

Just plug it in and get ready to play the way you like: to win.
